name: Quantified Us
tagline: A Guide to Collecting and Benefiting From Your Self-Tracking Data
body:
# Geolocation Data

Geolocation data can be collected automatically using a mobile device like a smartphone. Both GPS and cell tower plus wifi triangulation can be used to compute a person's coordinates.

## Format

latitude,longitude,timestamp

My settings:
* time zone = local
* polling interval <= 60 seconds
* accuracy <= 200 meters

## Producers

### Android
Recommended: [GPS Logger on Android](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.mendhak.gpslogger&hl=en)

##### Alternatives
* [Google Location History](https://maps.google.com/locationhistory/)
* [Saga](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.aro.saga) allows manual export to JSON that takes up to 24 hours
* [Geotracks](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.geoloqi.geotracks) automatically uploaded to Geoloqi, which can be downloaded via API

### iPhone
Recommended: [Saga](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/saga-beautiful-diary-that/id611593488) allows manual export to JSON that takes up to 24 hours

##### Alternatives
* [OpenPaths](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/openpaths/id493605283) is a New York Times open source project is a bit dated by uploads location data to their servers which can be exported.

## Consumers

* Interactive map visualization
* Route recommendations
* Dashboard or destinations, modes of transportation, distance traveled
* Daily schedule of location
* Privacy-enabled sharing

## Examples

* https://geoloqi.com/blog/2012/03/data-portraits-powered-by-3-5-years-of-data-and-2-5-million-gps-points/
* http://vimeo.com/groups/quantifiedself/videos/64204618
* http://personalinformatics.org/docs/chi2013/larsen.pdf
